channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Barbershop: President Trump's Paris Accord Decision And Kathy Griffin
item.description: June 3, 2017 - Farajii Muhammad, host of Listen Up! on WEAA in Baltimore, political commentator Gayle Trotter and Ask a Mexican columnist Gustavo Arellano discuss the Paris Accord decision and comic Kathy Griffin.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 3, 2017 - Farajii Muhammad, host of Listen Up! on WEAA in Baltimore, political commentator Gayle Trotter and Ask a Mexican columnist Gustavo Arellano discuss the Paris Accord decision and comic Kathy Griffin. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/03/531397408/barbershop-president-trumps-paris-accord-decision-and-kathy-griffin

item.title: Energy Economist Says Paris Accord Withdraw Doesn't Mean Much For U.S. Energy
item.description: June 3, 2017 - With 40 percent of the nation's coal, Wyoming is by far the largest coal-producing state. NPR's Michel Martin talks about the future of coal production with energy economist Robert Godby.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 3, 2017 - With 40 percent of the nation's coal, Wyoming is by far the largest coal-producing state. NPR's Michel Martin talks about the future of coal production with energy economist Robert Godby. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/03/531397401/energy-economist-says-paris-accord-withdraw-doesnt-mean-much-for-u-s-energy

item.title: Former Energy Secretary Says Climate Change Needs 'A Robust Response'
item.description: June 3, 2017 - President Trump said the U.S. has withdrawn from the Paris Climate Accord. NPR's Michel Martin talks about possible effects with Ernest Moniz, former energy secretary and an MIT professor.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 3, 2017 - President Trump said the U.S. has withdrawn from the Paris Climate Accord. NPR's Michel Martin talks about possible effects with Ernest Moniz, former energy secretary and an MIT professor. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/03/531397394/former-energy-secretary-says-climate-change-needs-a-robust-response

item.title: What Leaving The Paris Climate Accord Means For Corporations
item.description: June 2, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Christopher Flavelle, who covers climate change for Bloomberg, about some of the corporate winners and losers of President Trump's decision to withdraw from the Paris Climate Agreement.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Christopher Flavelle, who covers climate change for Bloomberg, about some of the corporate winners and losers of President Trump's decision to withdraw from the Paris Climate Agreement. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/02/531269074/what-leaving-the-paris-climate-accord-means-for-corporations

item.title: Week In Politics: Trump Withdraws U.S. From Paris Climate Accord
item.description: June 2, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel speaks with our regular political commentators, E.J. Dionne of The Washington Post and Brookings Institution and David Brooks of The New York Times, about President Trump's decision to withdraw from the Paris Climate Agreement and what it means for the country's role on the world stage.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel speaks with our regular political commentators, E.J. Dionne of The Washington Post and Brookings Institution and David Brooks of The New York Times, about President Trump's decision to withdraw from the Paris Climate Agreement and what it means for the country's role on the world stage. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/02/531269018/week-in-politics-trump-withdraws-u-s-from-paris-climate-accord

item.title: White House Defends U.S. Withdrawal From Paris Climate Agreement
item.description: June 2, 2017 - The Trump administration is defending its decision to withdraw the U.S. from the Paris Climate Agreement, despite international condemnation.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - The Trump administration is defending its decision to withdraw the U.S. from the Paris Climate Agreement, despite international condemnation. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/02/531269011/white-house-defends-u-s-withdrawal-from-paris-climate-agreement

item.title: The Soprano And The Scientist: A Conversation About Music And Medicine
item.description: June 2, 2017 - NIH Director Francis Collins and Renée Fleming, who is Artistic Advisor at Large for the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., discuss music and medicine. They also sing a duet.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - NIH Director Francis Collins and Renée Fleming, who is Artistic Advisor at Large for the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., discuss music and medicine. They also sing a duet. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/02/530879198/the-soprano-and-the-scientist-a-conversation-about-music-and-medicine

item.title: Bloomberg Promises $15 Million To Help Make Up For U.S. Withdrawal From Climate Deal
item.description: June 2, 2017 - "Americans will honor and fulfill the Paris Agreement by leading from the bottom up — and there isn't anything Washington can do to stop us," Michael Bloomberg said.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - "Americans will honor and fulfill the Paris Agreement by leading from the bottom up — and there isn't anything Washington can do to stop us," Michael Bloomberg said. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/02/531238185/bloomberg-promises-15-million-to-help-make-up-for-u-s-withdrawal-from-climate-de

item.title: Many COPD Patients Struggle To Pay For Each Breath
item.description: June 2, 2017 - One in 9 Medicare enrollees have chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and many of them can't afford the inhalers that keep them out of the emergency room.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - One in 9 Medicare enrollees have chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and many of them can't afford the inhalers that keep them out of the emergency room. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/02/529759280/many-copd-patients-struggle-to-pay-for-each-breath

item.title: The Role Of Yoga In Healing Trauma
item.description:
June 2, 2017 - So-called 'trauma-aware yoga' has mind and body benefits, says Georgetown research.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/06/02/527570310/the-role-of-yoga-in-healing-trauma

item.title: Why Recycling Options Lead People To Waste More
item.description: June 2, 2017 - People used more cups and paper when recycling was an option versus when they had to put them in the trash. Researchers say people's guilt for wasting is overridden by the good feelings for recycling.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - People used more cups and paper when recycling was an option versus when they had to put them in the trash. Researchers say people's guilt for wasting is overridden by the good feelings for recycling. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/02/531173499/why-recycling-options-lead-people-to-waste-more

item.title: Trump's Speech On Paris Climate Agreement Withdrawal, Annotated
item.description: June 1, 2017 - NPR journalists have fact-checked and analyzed the president's announcement that the U.S. will pull out of the international accord, including Trump's comments on terrorism and the economy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - NPR journalists have fact-checked and analyzed the president's announcement that the U.S. will pull out of the international accord, including Trump's comments on terrorism and the economy. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531090243/trumps-speech-on-paris-climate-agreement-withdrawal-annotated

item.title: Mars Incorporated Criticizes Trump's Decision To Leave Paris Climate Accord
item.description: June 1, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Andy Pharoah, vice president for corporate affairs at Mars Incorporated, about why the company is such an avid backer of the Paris Climate Agreement.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Andy Pharoah, vice president for corporate affairs at Mars Incorporated, about why the company is such an avid backer of the Paris Climate Agreement. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531099035/mars-incorporated-criticizes-trumps-decision-to-leave-paris-climate-accord

item.title: Using Music And Rhythm To Help Kids With Grammar And Language
item.description: June 1, 2017 - Researchers at Vanderbilt University Medical Center are studying how music and rhythm activities could help children who struggle with grammar and language development.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - Researchers at Vanderbilt University Medical Center are studying how music and rhythm activities could help children who struggle with grammar and language development. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/01/530723046/using-music-and-rhythm-to-help-kids-with-grammar-and-language

item.title: Montana Town Exemplifies Coal Country's Uncertain Future
item.description: June 1, 2017 - The Trump administration has declared an end to the "war on coal," but Colstrip, Mont., is still feeling besieged. The town is a good example of how complicated the future is for coal country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - The Trump administration has declared an end to the "war on coal," but Colstrip, Mont., is still feeling besieged. The town is a good example of how complicated the future is for coal country. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531099076/montana-town-exemplifies-coal-countrys-uncertain-future
